metadata.title: CVE-2019-16394 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
SPIP before 3.1.11 and 3.2 before 3.2.5 provides different error messagesfrom the password-reminder page depending on whether an e-mail addressexists, which might help attackers to enumerate subscribers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.2.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.5-1').
